newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka ends up on lower dollar demand.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka ends up on lower dollar demand.

text.p: The Bangladesh taka gained slightly on poor dollar demand and closed at 42.5300/5400 in interbank trading compared with the previous 42.5320/5420,dealers said.
The taka opened mostly steady at 42.5330/5440 but later gained amid lack of demand for the dollar, as most of the international markets were closed for weekend.

Dealers said the interbank call money rates closed up at 5.25 percent to 5.5 percent from the previous 3.75 to 4.25 percent. There was a liquidity crunch after Thursday's auction of more than a billion taka worth of treasury bills by the central bank. Friday is weekend in Moslem Bangladesh.
